intro: Helicteres carthagonensis, commonly known as the Carthaginian helicteres, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
